docs.snippet: The vote ended the British territory’s 16-year fight for soccer recognition but threatened to stir a centuries-old dispute with Spain....

docs.abstract: UEFA, European soccer's governing body, votes to include Gibraltar as its 54th member, clearing the way for its teams to compete in the European championships and the Champions League.

headline.seo: UEFA Makes Gibraltar a Full Member

headline.main: Reaching Backward for the Glory Days in Colorado

docs.snippet: TOPCHIK--Robert J., 86. formerly of Passiac and Clifton, passed away peacefully in his home in Boca Raton Florida on Wednesday May 22, 2013, surrounded by his wife and children. A service will be held at the Jewish Memorial Chapel, 841 Allwood Roa...
docs.lead_paragraph: TOPCHIK--Robert J., 86. formerly of Passiac and Clifton, passed away peacefully in his home in Boca Raton Florida on Wednesday May 22, 2013, surrounded by his wife and children. A service will be held at the Jewish Memorial Chapel, 841 Allwood Road, Clifton, at 11:00am on Sunday, May 26, 2013. Born and raised in Passaic, Bob, known to many of his friends as "Tippy" or "Toppy", was a spectacular athlete, a "natural" talent in all sports, particularly tennis and golf. He was a hurdler and basketball player, but best known for his speed and prowess as a football player for Passaic High School and the University of Pennsylvania, where he was one of the "Munger" men. He served in the U.S. Army during World War II and then attended Penn on the GI Bill, graduating from the Wharton School. He was a member of ZBT. Bob and his wife of 62 years, Phyllis, met at Penn. They married and moved to New Jersey, where he started his own insurance business. He was an independent agent, serving personal and business clients throughout Northern New Jersey for more than 40 years, until he retired. In a life dedicated to serving and helping other people, he was, among other things, a President of the Board of Trustees of the Passaic Beth Israel Hospital, a President of the American Friends of Tel Aviv University, a Chair of the Passaic-Clifton UJA, a member of the Clifton Board of Education, a President of the PTA of the Montclair College High School and an active supporter of countless other charities and causes. He had an exceptional joy and passion for life, and was an unwavering and unconditional friend. Bob's beloved parents, Wolf ("Ben") and Lillian ("Libby") Topchik, brother Abraham ("Abe") and sister Sylvia ("Simi") Levine predeceased him. In addition to his wife, Phyllis, and his children Meryl and husband Richard Ringle, David, Alan and wife Yazz, and John Topchik, Bob is survived by five wonderful grandchildren, Eric, Samantha, Hugh, Caroline and Ethan. In lieu of flowers, donations may be made in his name to American Friends of Tel Aviv University, 39 Broadway, Suite 1510, NY 10006 to the attention of Ari Wein, noting that the donation is to be designated to the Phyllis and Robert Topchik Scholarship Fund for Post Graduate Studies. Donations may also be made to Israel Congregation of Manchester Vermont, 6025 Main Street, Manchester Center, Vermont 05255, or Hospice by the Sea, Boca Raton, FL.

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  TOPCHIK, ROBERT J.

docs.snippet: Learning game strategies and player pronunciations, all while dealing with a rabid fan base, posed challenges for Gus Johnson in his first year as a soccer broadcaster for Fox....
docs.lead_paragraph: Learning game strategies and player pronunciations, all while dealing with a rabid fan base, posed challenges for Gus Johnson in his first year as a soccer broadcaster for Fox.

docs.snippet: The conviction of Nelson Morales was the third to result from the shooting death of Officer Peter J. Figoski in 2011....
docs.lead_paragraph: The conviction of Nelson Morales was the third to result from the shooting death of Officer Peter J. Figoski in 2011.
docs.abstract: Nelson Morales, Queens man who helped hatch drug robbery plot that led to shooting death of New York City police officer Peter J Figoski, is convicted of second-degree murder, third conviction to result from the officer’s death.

headline.seo: Queens Man Convicted of Murder in Robbery That Led to a Death
headline.main: 3rd Conviction in Robbery That Left Officer Dead
headline.print_headline: 3rd Conviction in Robbery That Left Officer Dead

docs.snippet: Sheik Mansour bin Zayed al-Nahyan, whose investment group owns Manchester City and will pay for the New York City soccer club, has stayed largely out of day-to-day operations of the new team....
docs.lead_paragraph: Sheik Mansour bin Zayed al-Nahyan, whose investment group owns Manchester City and will pay for the New York City soccer club, has stayed largely out of day-to-day operations of the new team.
docs.abstract: Sheik Mansour bin Zayed al-Nahyan, whose investment group Abu Dhabi United Group owns Manchester City and will pay for the New York City Football Club, which he owns with the New York Yankees, has stayed largely out of day-to-day operations of the new team; sheik's fund is set to spend hundreds of millions of dollars to build a stadium, either in Flushing Meadows, Queens, or somewhere else in the city.

headline.seo: Sheik Mansour, Hand Behind Manchester City, Is Content to Stay in Background in New York
headline.main: The Power Behind Manchester City Is Content to Stay Out of Sight in New York
headline.print_headline: The Power Behind Manchester City Is Content to Stay Out of Sight in New York

byline.contributor: John Otis and Robert Worth contributed reporting.
